title: Paraguay far-right populist presidential candidate arrested
description: Police in Paraguay have detained Paraguayo Cubas, a far-right populist who came in third in Sunday’s presidential election and had alleged without evidence that the vote was marred by fraud

title: Leaked U.S. files show deep rift between Russian military and Wagner chief
description: While Yevgeniy Prigozhin has led Russia’s bloody campaign to capture Bakhmut with mercenaries and convicts, he’s been locked in a fight with the Defense Ministry.

title: Over 2,000 migrants kidnapped in Mexico last year
description: Mexico’s government says over 2,000 migrants were kidnapped by smuggling gangs and drug cartels in 2022, as authorities embarked on a search for ten Colombians abducted in northern Mexico this week

title: Great Britain to donate $100 million to Brazil's Amazon Fund
description: Britain has pledged to give about $100 million to the Brazilian government’s fund to protect the Amazon rainforest, as the South American country beefs up protection of the environment under its new leadership

title: Sudan’s warring sides send envoys for talks in Saudi Arabia
description: Sudanese officials say that the country’s two warring generals have sent their envoys to Saudi Arabia for talks aimed at firming up a shaky cease-fire after three weeks of fierce fighting that has killed hundreds and pushed Sudan to the brink of collapse

title: UN again seeks to reassure Afghans it will deliver aid
description: The United Nations is seeking yet again to reassure the Afghan people that it won’t abandon them

title: UN experts warn Taliban restrictions may amount to femicide
description: U.N. experts are warning that Taliban restrictions on Afghan women and girls may amount to femicide if they are not reversed

title: All the king’s ... swans? A quiz on the British royals’ assets.
description: How much do you know about the properties and other assets owned by the king, the royal family or the Crown?

title: Chile to choose constitutional council, but apathy reigns
description: Chile will vote Sunday to choose 50 delegates to a council that will draw up a new Constitution, after voters overwhelmingly rejected a proposed charter last year that was widely described as one of the world’s most progressive

title: What is the Wagner Group, the Russian mercenary outfit in Ukraine?
description: The United States estimates the Wagner Group has about 50,000 fighters in Ukraine.

title: WHO says COVID emergency is over. So what does that mean?
description: The World Health Organization says COVID-19 is no longer a global emergency but the coronavirus is here to stay

title: Germany: Man rescued from woods after sex game goes awry
description: German police say a 51-year-old man who was left tied up in the woods when a sex game went awry had a lucky escape, after a cyclist and a hunter heard his screams for help

title: King Charles, William and Kate meet royal superfans on coronation eve
description: Royal fans have descended on London from all over the world, carrying tents and cardboard cutouts of Charles and an impressive array of homemade crowns.

title: 4 Cambodians die in accident at unlicensed gold mine
description: Four Cambodian prospectors who were digging for gold in a central province have died when earth collapsed into the pit where they were mining

title: Kenyan pastor suspected in cult deaths to remain jailed
description: A court in Kenya has given police five more days to hold a pastor facing possible terror-related charges in the deaths of more than 100 his congregants

title: How countries around the world have responded to mass shootings
description: After mass shootings, Serbia’s president pledged to disarm the country. He is not alone: Australia, Britain, Canada and New Zealand tightened their gun control in response to mass shootings.

title: The many details of Coronation Day show the king Charles wants to be
description: Sustainable. Inclusive. Scaled-down. King Charles III’s coronation choices preview how he may try to appeal to those who are apathetic about the monarchy.

title: The Koh-i-Noor and Cullinan diamonds: British crown jewels have fraught history
description: South Africans have demanded the return of the Cullinan diamonds, which will feature heavily during King Charles III’s coronation Saturday.

title: Suspect in slaying of Syrian surrenders to German police
description: German authorities say that a man sought in connection with the fatal shooting of a 24-year-old Syrian in the western town of Luedenscheid has been detained after surrendering to police

title: Nigerian senator, wife jailed in UK for organ-harvest plot
description: A senior Nigerian politician and his wife have been handed prison sentences for conspiring to transport a street trader to the U.K. as part of an organ-harvesting plot

title: King Charles III surprises crowd outside Buckingham Palace
description: Kings Charles III has surprised a crowd of people assembled outside Buckingham Palace awaiting his coronation

title: WHO declares covid-19 no longer global health emergency
description: The World Health Organization lifted its designation, signifying a lessening of the danger posed by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Spain's April heat nearly impossible without climate change
description: Record-breaking April temperatures in Spain, Portugal and northern Africa were made 100 times more likely by human-caused climate change, a new flash study found, and would have been almost impossible in the past

title: German chancellor supports permanent UNSC seat for Africa
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has offered support to African countries to get a permanent seat in the U

title: Funeral held in Ukraine for American man killed in action
description: Soldiers from the International Legion of Ukraine said farewell Friday to an American military veteran they served with, who was killed a month ago in the fierce struggle to prevent the eastern city of Bakhmut from falling into Russian hands

title: 15 killed in Congo flooding, with toll expected to rise
description: A local official in Congo says rescue efforts are underway after flooding and landslides brought on by torrential overnight rains in the eastern province South Kivu province killed more than a dozen people

title: Russian mercenary leader slams army, will pull out forces from Bakhmut
description: Yevgeniy Prigozhin, the Wagner Group boss, has shared videos of dead fighters before, but his open rage against military officials in the graphic video was unusual.

title: Kidnapped Nigerian girls freed, return to Chibok with babies
description: The Nigerian military says it has rescued two young women who were kidnapped nine years ago by the jihadi militant group Boko Haram

title: The diamond too controversial for Camilla’s crown: A visual history
description: The Koh-i-Noor diamond has adorned the crowns of previous queen consorts, but it will not be on Queen Camilla's.

title: Indonesia works to rescue 20 trafficking victims in Myanmar
description: Indonesian officials say they are working to rescue dozens of their nationals who were trafficked to Myanmar to work as cyber scammers, amid an increase in human trafficking cases in Southeast Asia

title: Pope seeks to encourage abuse prevention board amid turmoil
description: Pope Francis is seeking to encourage his embattled child protection advisory board following weeks of turmoil and a shock resignation

title: Mourners attend funerals of 7 Shiite teachers in NW Pakistan
description: Officials say thousands of mourners have attended the mass funeral of seven minority Shiite teachers who were shot and killed at a school in northwestern Pakistan

title: Russia's Wagner boss threatens Bakhmut pullout in Ukraine
description: The owner of Russia’s Wagner Group military contractor is threatening to pull his troops out of the protracted battle for the eastern Ukraine city of Bakhmut next week

title: Arab ministers to meet over Syria's return to Arab league
description: Officials say diplomats from Arab nations are planning an emergency meeting in Cairo over the weekend about fighting in Sudan and the return of Syria to the Arab League

title: In photos: Serbia reels from second mass killing in two days
description: Police arrested a suspect in the shootings across three villages near Mladenovac. The attack came a day after a deadly school shooting in Belgrade.

title: Strong earthquake hits Japan; no tsunami threat
description: A strong earthquake has hit near central Japan, but officials say there was no preliminary damage and no threat of a tsunami

title: Belgium arrests Iraqi suspected of terror attack involvement
description: Belgian authorities have arrested an Iraqi suspect accused of involvement in terror attacks in Baghdad more than a decade ago that killed hundreds of people

title: King's coronation draws apathy, criticism in former colonies
description: When King Charles III is crowned on Saturday, soldiers carrying flags from the Bahamas, South Africa, Tuvalu and beyond will be marching alongside British troops to honor king and country

title: Sudan migrants in Israel worry over future, fighting at home
description: Sudanese migrants in Israel are watching the fighting roiling their nation with trepidation

title: Ukraine live briefing: 4th day of strikes in Kyiv; Kremlin vows revenge for drone incident
description: The United Nations said it was “appalled and saddened” by the bombardments, as Moscow vowed retaliation for an alleged attack on the Kremlin.

title: Realms eyeing a split from monarchy mostly ignore Charles’s coronation
description: Even in those Commonwealth realms that aren't planning to sever ties, the coronation of Charles III as their king is drawing shrugs.

title: Turkey elections: Are voters ready to move on from Erdogan?
description: In interviews across Istanbul, voters expressed anxiety about the state of their finances ahead of pivotal presidential and parliamentary elections on May 14.

title: King Charles III could be Britain’s first post-colonial monarch
description: If Queen Elizabeth II represented a post-imperial monarch, her son could be Britain’s first post-colonial royal.
